abstract: More than 3,000 people attend ceremony at Auschwitz-Birkenau State Museum in Poland marking 70th anniversary of liberation of those death camps, with about 300 survivors of camps in attendance; ceremony may be last major anniversary celebration as survivors are advancing in age.
lead_paragraph: In 2005, about 1,500 survivors attended the 60th anniversary of the liberation of the death camps. This year, there were fewer than 300.

byline.contributor: Alison Smale contributed reporting from Berlin.

snippet: In 2005, about 1,500 survivors attended the 60th anniversary of the liberation of the death camps. This year, there were fewer than 300.

headline.main: Outliving Horror for 70 Years and Never Forgetting
headline.seo: At Auschwitz-Birkenau, Holocaust Survivors, Ever Dwindling in Number, Gather to Remember
headline.print_headline: Outliving Horror for 70 Years and Never Forgetting
